summary: This document is a compilation of Bureau of Prisons (BOP) medical records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein from July to August 2019, while he was held at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM). It details his health assessments, vital signs, diagnoses, medications, and preparations for a transfer on August 10, 2019. The records note multiple health issues and include a note to 'R/O self inflicted injuries'.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The subject of all medical records, detailing his health status, diagnoses, and care while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM).

persons.name: MLP
persons.context: A healthcare provider (Mid-Level Provider, e.g., Nurse Practitioner or Physician Assistant) who conducted Epstein's physical exam on July 9, 2019, and entered several medical orders and assessments.

persons.name: PA-C
persons.context: A certified physician assistant who administered a PPD (tuberculosis) test to Epstein on July 6, 2019, and noted 'No Known Allergies'.

persons.name: PhD/Chief Psychologist
persons.context: Listed as the provider for a 'No Diagnosis' entry on July 9, 2019, indicating a psychological assessment.

connections.description: MLP conducted Epstein's physical examination, prescribed medication (Bisacodyl), and provided patient education.
MD cosigned MLP's work, prescribed medications (e.g., Medrol, insulin), and managed chronic conditions like hypertension.
RN prepared his transfer summary, monitored his vitals, and provided patient education on care access and plans.
MD cosigned the medical documentation completed by the MLP, indicating a supervisory or collaborative clinical relationship.

events.title: Epstein's Comprehensive Physical Exam
events.description: A mid-level provider (MLP) conducted a full physical examination of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The exam noted normal findings in several systems, a history of constipation, and refusals for rectal and male genitalia exams. A PPD test was read as negative.

events.title: Injury Assessment
events.description: An 'Injury, unspecified' was noted in Epstein's health problems, with a comment to 'R/O self inflicted injuries.' The provider was an MLP.

events.title: Medical Transfer Preparation
events.description: A comprehensive medical transfer summary was generated by an RN in preparation for Epstein's transfer from the New York MCC. It listed all his active health problems, medications, allergies (fish), and pending appointments.

locations: 150 PARK ROW, NEW YORK, New York 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's Bureau of Prisons medical records from July-August 2019 show he had multiple chronic health issues, including hyperlipidemia, sleep apnea, hypertension, constipation, low back pain, neuralgia, prediabetes, and a BMI in the overweight range.
A note dated July 23, 2019, lists an 'Injury, unspecified' with the instruction 'R/O self inflicted injuries,' indicating medical staff were assessing for possible self-harm.

Epstein was prescribed regular insulin via sliding scale twice daily in late July/early August 2019 for blood glucose management, alongside other medications like docusate sodium and omega-3 capsules.
The records show he refused rectal and male genitalia examinations during his physical on July 9, 2019.
A transfer summary was prepared on August 10, 2019, detailing his medical status for a planned move from the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center.
